properties.areaDesc: Delta; Alger; Menominee; Southern Schoolcraft; Marquette; Northern Schoolcraft; Luce
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 2:50PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
A developing winter storm system approaching from the mid-
Mississippi Valley will bring light snow for central Upper
Michigan Saturday night. A very dry airmass northeast of Lake
Superior will bring in some very dry air to the lower and mid
levels of the atmosphere. This dry air will make the snow flake
size very small and combined with some gusty northeast winds, this
will cause very low visibilities in the light snow due to blowing
and drifting snow. These strong northeast winds will have the
potential to gust as high as 30 to 40 mph near the Lake Superior
shoreline and along the Bay of Green Bay in southern Menominee
County. The northeast Lake Superior snowbelts will see reduced
visibilities on Saturday.

The strong northeast winds could also cause minor lakeshore
flooding and beach erosion late Saturday into early Sunday for
locations along Lake Superior from Marquette through Keweenaw Bay,
and also along the Bay of Green Bay from Cedar River to Menominee.

Those planning travel or recreational activities in Upper Michigan
later this weekend, need to stay tuned to the latest forecasts
and updated statements on this low visibility light snow event.

NWSheadline: Lower visibilities possible in parts of central Upper Michigan Saturday into Saturday night
